article:
# Running Up That Hill
"Running Up That Hill" is a song by the English singer-songwriter Kate Bush, released in 1985 as the lead single from her fifth studio album, "Hounds of Love". The song was a major hit, reaching the top 10 in several countries and becoming one of Bush's signature songs.

## Music and lyrics
"Running Up That Hill" is a mid-tempo song with a mix of rock and pop elements. The song features a distinctive drum machine pattern and a soaring chorus, with Bush's vocals ranging from soft and introspective to loud and emotive. The lyrics of the song describe a desire to switch lives with someone else, in order to understand their perspective and alleviate their suffering. The song's title is a reference to the idea of running up a hill, a metaphor for the challenge of overcoming obstacles and achieving a deeper understanding of others.

## Recording
"Running Up That Hill" was recorded at Bush's home studio, with the singer-songwriter producing the track herself. The song features a range of instruments, including guitars, bass, and keyboards, as well as a drum machine. Bush has said that she used a combination of Fairlight and Emulator synthesizers to create the song's distinctive sound. The song's vocals were recorded in a single take, with Bush singing live over the instrumental backing track.

## Music video
The music video for "Running Up That Hill" was directed by Kate Bush and Tim Pope. The video features Bush performing the song in a series of surreal and abstract settings, including a dark forest and a room filled with smoke. The video also includes footage of Bush dancing and singing, as well as a number of symbolic and metaphorical images. The video was widely played on MTV and other music channels, and helped to establish Bush as a major visual artist.

## Release
"Running Up That Hill" was released in August 1985, as the lead single from Bush's album "Hounds of Love". The song was a major hit, reaching number 3 on the UK Singles Chart and number 30 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song also reached the top 10 in several other countries, including Australia, Canada, and Germany.

## 2012 Olympics remix
In 2012, a remix of "Running Up That Hill" was used as the soundtrack for the closing ceremony of the London Olympics. The remix, which was created by Bush and her longtime collaborator Del Palmer, featured a new vocal performance by Bush, as well as a number of additional instrumental elements. The remix was widely praised, and helped to introduce Bush's music to a new generation of listeners.

## 2022 revival and Stranger Things
In 2022, "Running Up That Hill" experienced a major revival, thanks in part to its use in the popular Netflix series "Stranger Things". The song was featured in the show's fourth season, and quickly became a hit on social media and music streaming platforms. The song's streaming numbers increased by over 8,000% in the days following its appearance on the show, and it eventually reached the top 10 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart for the first time in over 30 years.

## Critical response
"Running Up That Hill" has been widely praised by critics, who have noted its innovative production, soaring vocals, and timeless lyrics. The song has been named one of the greatest songs of all time by a number of publications, including Rolling Stone and Pitchfork. Bush's performance on the song has also been widely praised, with many noting her impressive vocal range and emotional delivery.

## Live performances
"Running Up That Hill" has been a staple of Bush's live shows for many years, and has been performed in a number of different arrangements. Bush has performed the song with a full band, as well as in more stripped-down settings, featuring just her voice and a piano or guitar. The song has also been featured in a number of Bush's live videos and DVDs, including "Live at Hammersmith Odeon" and "Before the Dawn".

## Cover versions
"Running Up That Hill" has been covered by a number of artists over the years, including Placebo, Within Temptation, and Dar Williams. The song has also been featured in a number of films and television shows, including "The Simpsons" and "My So-Called Life".

## Track listing and formats
"Running Up That Hill" was released in a number of different formats, including 7-inch and 12-inch singles, as well as a CD single. The song was also included on Bush's album "Hounds of Love", which was released in 1985.

## Personnel
* Kate Bush: vocals, keyboards, production
* Del Palmer: bass, guitar
* Stuart Elliott: drums
* Dave Lawson: keyboards
* Paddy Bush: guitar, vocals

## Charts

## Certifications

article:
Cirkus (film)

Cirkus is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language period comedy film directed by Rohit Shetty and produced by Rohit Shetty Picturez and T-Series. The film stars Ranveer Singh, Pooja Hegde, and Jacqueline Fernandez in lead roles. Cirkus is an adaptation of William Shakespeare's play The Comedy of Errors, with the story set in the 1960s.

# Plot

The film is set in the 1960s and revolves around two sets of identical twins who were accidentally separated at birth. The story follows the journey of the twins as they navigate their lives and ultimately reunite. Ranveer Singh plays a double role, portraying the characters of two sets of identical twins. The film explores themes of love, family, and identity, set against the backdrop of a circus.

# Cast

* Ranveer Singh as Rohan/Arjun
* Pooja Hegde as Mala
* Jacqueline Fernandez as Bindu
* Varun Sharma as Ganguly
* Siddhartha Jadhav as Bakhshi
* Johnny Lever as Daddu
* Sanjay Mishra as Kalachand
* Mukesh Tiwari as Lamba
* Vrajesh Hirjee as Ganguya
* Anil Charanjeett as Chandu
* Ashwini Kalsekar as Kalavati
* Murli Sharma as Purushottam
* Vijay Patkar as Suresh

# Production

## Development

Rohit Shetty announced Cirkus in 2020, with Ranveer Singh set to star in the film. The film was initially titled "Comedy of Errors", but was later changed to Cirkus. Rohit Shetty stated that the film would be a comedy of errors, with Ranveer Singh playing a double role. The film's script was written by Yunus Sajawal and Farhad Samji.

## Casting

Ranveer Singh was the first actor to be cast in the film, with Rohit Shetty announcing that Singh would play a double role. Pooja Hegde and Jacqueline Fernandez were later cast as the female leads. Varun Sharma, Siddhartha Jadhav, and Johnny Lever were also cast in supporting roles.

## Filming

Principal photography for Cirkus began in November 2020. The film was shot in various locations, including Mumbai, Goa, and Ooty. Ranveer Singh performed many of his own stunts in the film. The film's shooting schedule was wrapped up in March 2022.

## Post-production

Post-production for Cirkus began in April 2022. The film's editing was handled by Bunty Nagi, while the visual effects were handled by NY VFXWala. The film's music was composed by Devi Sri Prasad.

# Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by Devi Sri Prasad, with lyrics written by Kumaar and Ashish Pandit. The soundtrack features five tracks, including the title track "Cirkus", which was released in November 2022. The film's background score was also composed by Devi Sri Prasad.

# Release

## Theatrical

Cirkus was released theatrically on December 23, 2022. The film was released in over 3000 screens in India and internationally.

## Home media

Cirkus was made available on digital platforms in January 2023. The film was also released on DVD and Blu-ray in February 2023.

# Reception

## Critical response

Cirkus received mixed reviews from critics. Many praised Ranveer Singh's performance, while others criticized the film's script and direction. The film holds a rating of 40% on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 20 reviews.

## Box office

Cirkus performed moderately well at the box office. The film grossed over ₹150 crore worldwide, with ₹100 crore coming from India. The film was declared a semi-hit by Box Office India.

article:
2023 ICC Women's T20 World Cup

The 2023 ICC Women's T20 World Cup was the eighth edition of the ICC Women's T20 World Cup, the biennial international Twenty20 women's cricket tournament organized by the International Cricket Council (ICC). The tournament was held in South Africa from 10 to 26 February 2023.

# Teams and qualification

A total of 12 teams participated in the tournament. The top eight teams from the 2020 ICC Women's T20 World Cup, along with the hosts South Africa, automatically qualified for the tournament. The remaining three teams were determined through the 2022 ICC Women's T20 World Cup Qualifier, which was held in the United Arab Emirates in September 2022.

The teams that qualified for the tournament were:

*  Australia
*  Bangladesh
*  England
*  India
*  Ireland
*  New Zealand
*  Pakistan
*  South Africa (hosts)
*  Sri Lanka
*  United Arab Emirates
*  West Indies
*  Zimbabwe

# Squads

article:
Treat Williams
================

Treat Williams was an American actor and children's book author, best known for his starring roles in the films "Hair" (1979), "Prince of the City" (1981), and "Everwood" (2002-2006). With a career spanning over five decades, Williams established himself as a talented and versatile actor, appearing in a wide range of film, television, and theatre productions.

Early life and education
------------------------

Richard Treat Williams was born on December 1, 1951, in Stamford, Connecticut, to Marian (née Andrews) and Richard Norman Williams. His father was a corporate executive, and his mother was a homemaker. Williams grew up in Rowayton, Connecticut, and developed an interest in acting at an early age. He attended the Kent School, a private boarding school in Kent, Connecticut, where he began performing in school plays.

After graduating from high school, Williams attended Franklin & Marshall College in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, but dropped out after one year to pursue a career in acting. He moved to New York City and began studying at the prestigious Juilliard School, where he honed his craft and developed his skills as a young actor.

Career
--------

### 1972–1979: Stage work and film breakthrough

Williams began his professional career in the early 1970s, performing in various stage productions in New York City. He made his Broadway debut in 1972 in the musical "Grease," and went on to appear in several other stage productions, including "Fiddler on the Roof" and "Hair."

In 1979, Williams made his film debut in the musical "Hair," directed by Miloš Forman. The film was a critical and commercial success, and Williams' performance as Berger, the charismatic leader of a group of hippies, earned him widespread recognition.

### 1980s roles

Throughout the 1980s, Williams appeared in a wide range of film and television productions. He starred in the 1981 film "Prince of the City," directed by Sidney Lumet, and received critical acclaim for his performance as Daniel Ciello, a corrupt police officer. He also appeared in the films "The Pursuit of D.B. Cooper" (1981), " Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead" (1985), and "Dead Heat" (1988).

### 1990s–2006: Film, theatre, and Everwood

In the 1990s and 2000s, Williams continued to work in film and television, appearing in a wide range of productions. He starred in the 1993 film "Handgun," and appeared in the television series "Chase" (1993) and "Brooklyn Bridge" (1991-1993). In 2002, he landed the starring role of Dr. Andy Brown in the WB drama series "Everwood," which ran for four seasons and earned him multiple award nominations.

### 2007–2023: Final years

In his final years, Williams continued to work in film and television, appearing in a wide range of productions. He starred in the 2007 film "Moola," and appeared in the television series " Brothers & Sisters" (2007-2008) and "White Collar" (2009-2014). He also continued to work in theatre, appearing in several stage productions, including "Guys and Dolls" and "The Fantasticks."

Accolades
----------

Throughout his career, Williams received numerous award nominations and wins for his performances. He was nominated for two Golden Globe Awards for his performances in "Prince of the City" and "Everwood," and won a Screen Actors Guild Award for his performance in "Everwood."

Personal life
-------------

### Addiction issues

Williams has been open about his struggles with addiction, and has spoken publicly about his experiences with substance abuse. In the 1980s, he struggled with cocaine addiction, and has since become an advocate for addiction recovery.

Death
------

Treat Williams passed away on December 12, 2023, at the age of 72, after a long battle with cancer.

Tributes
---------

Following his death, Williams received numerous tributes from his colleagues and fans. He was remembered as a talented and versatile actor, and a generous and kind person.

article:
Bheeshma Parvam
================

Bheeshma Parvam is a 2022 Indian Malayalam-language crime drama film written and directed by Amal Neerad. The film stars Mammootty, Sreenath Bhasi, and Nadhiya in lead roles. Bheeshma Parvam is a cinematic adaptation of William Shakespeare's Hamlet, set in the backdrop of Kochi's underworld.

Plot
-----

The story revolves around Michael, an aging don who is struggling to maintain his grip on the city's underworld. His younger brother, Peter, is more cunning and ambitious, and he begins to secretly plot against Michael. Meanwhile, Michael's son, Anarkali, returns from abroad after completing his education. Anarkali is a hot-headed and impulsive young man who is fiercely loyal to his family.

As Peter's plans come to fruition, Michael is murdered, and Anarkali is left to avenge his death. With the help of his trusted friends, Anarkali sets out to uncover the truth behind his father's murder and bring the perpetrators to justice. Along the way, he must navigate the complex web of alliances and rivalries that define Kochi's underworld.

Cast
-----

* Mammootty as Michael
* Sreenath Bhasi as Anarkali
* Nadhiya as Fathima
* Farhaan Faasil as Peter
* Soubin Shahir as Ajai
* Dileesh Pothan as Paul
* Lena as Alice

### Family Tree

* Michael (Mammootty)
	+ Son: Anarkali (Sreenath Bhasi)
	+ Brother: Peter (Farhaan Faasil)
* Fathima (Nadhiya)
	+ Husband: Michael (Mammootty)
* Peter (Farhaan Faasil)
	+ Brother: Michael (Mammootty)
	+ Nephew: Anarkali (Sreenath Bhasi)

Production
------------

### Development

Bheeshma Parvam was first announced in 2020, with Mammootty and Amal Neerad teaming up for the third time after Big B and Iyobinte Pusthakam. The film was initially planned as a quickie, but the COVID-19 pandemic forced the team to postpone the shoot.

### Filming

Principal photography began in February 2021, with the team shooting on location in Kochi and surrounding areas. The film's cinematography was handled by Amal Neerad, who also handled the editing. The film's stunt choreography was handled by Mafia Sasi.

Soundtrack
------------

The film's soundtrack was composed by Sushin Shyam, who had previously worked with Amal Neerad on Comrade in America. The soundtrack features four songs, including the popular single "Parudeyam".

Release
--------

### Theatrical

Bheeshma Parvam was released in theaters on March 3, 2022. The film opened to positive reviews from critics, with many praising Mammootty's performance and the film's atmospheric direction.

### Home Media

The film was made available on Amazon Prime Video on April 1, 2022.

Reception
------------

### Box Office

Bheeshma Parvam was a commercial success, grossing over ₹50 crore at the box office. The film's success was attributed to its strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews from critics.

### Critical Response

Bheeshma Parvam received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's direction, performances, and atmospheric soundtrack. The film holds a rating of 7.5/10 on IMDB, based on over 10,000 user reviews.

In Popular Culture
-------------------

Bheeshma Parvam has been referenced in several popular culture outlets, including memes and social media posts. The film's dialogue and scenes have been widely shared and parodied online.

Notes
------

Bheeshma Parvam is the third collaboration between Mammootty and Amal Neerad, after Big B and Iyobinte Pusthakam. The film's title is inspired by the Hindu epic, the Mahabharata.

----------

article:
Karthikeya 2
================

Karthikeya 2 is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language supernatural thriller film written and directed by Chandoo Mondeti. The film stars Nikhil Siddhartha, Anupama Parameswaran, and Anupam Kher in key roles. It is a sequel to the 2014 film Karthikeya and follows the story of Karthikeya, a doctor who uncovers the secrets of the Lord Krishna temple in Dwaraka.

Plot
-----

The film begins with Karthikeya (Nikhil Siddhartha), a doctor who is on a mission to uncover the secrets of the Lord Krishna temple in Dwaraka. He is accompanied by his friend and colleague, Srinivas (Srinivas Reddy). As they delve deeper into the mysteries of the temple, they discover a cryptic message that leads them on a treasure hunt. Along the way, they encounter various obstacles and challenges that test their courage and wits.

As Karthikeya and Srinivas progress on their journey, they are joined by Mugdha (Anupama Parameswaran), a historian who is an expert on the mythology of Lord Krishna. Together, they uncover the secrets of the temple and the true story behind the mythology of Lord Krishna.

The film's plot is full of twists and turns, keeping the audience engaged and guessing until the very end. With its unique blend of mythology, history, and suspense, Karthikeya 2 is a thrilling ride that will keep viewers on the edge of their seats.

Cast
-----

* Nikhil Siddhartha as Karthikeya
* Anupama Parameswaran as Mugdha
* Anupam Kher as Dhanvantri
* Srinivas Reddy as Srinivas
* Harsha Chemudu as Rama
* Sathya as Satya
* Tulasi as Karthikeya's mother

Production
------------

The film was written and directed by Chandoo Mondeti, who previously directed the first installment of the Karthikeya series. The film was produced by Abhishek Agarwal and TG Vishwa Prasad under the banner of Abhishek Agarwal Arts and People Media Factory.

Principal photography began in November 2020 and was completed in March 2022. The film was shot on location in various places in India, including Rajahmundry, Dwaraka, and Ahmedabad.

Soundtrack
------------

The film's soundtrack was composed by Kaala Bhairava, who previously composed music for the first installment of the Karthikeya series. The soundtrack features five songs, including the popular single "Inayaa".

Release
--------

### Theatrical

Karthikeya 2 was released theatrically on August 13, 2022, in Telugu, Hindi, and Tamil languages. The film received a positive response from audiences and critics alike, with many praising its unique storyline, engaging plot, and impressive performances.

### Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on September 10, 2022, and was made available for streaming on Amazon Prime Video.

Reception
----------

### Critical reception

Karthikeya 2 received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising its unique storyline, engaging plot, and impressive performances. The film's direction, cinematography, and music were also appreciated by critics.

On the other hand, some critics felt that the film's pacing was slow and that some of the plot twists were predictable. However, overall, the film received a positive response from critics and audiences alike.

### Box office

Karthikeya 2 performed well at the box office, grossing over ₹100 crore worldwide. The film was a commercial success, and its success can be attributed to its unique storyline, engaging plot, and impressive performances.

Accolades
----------

Karthikeya 2 won several awards and nominations, including the SIIMA Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role for Anupam Kher's performance.

Future
--------

A sequel to Karthikeya 2 is reportedly in the works, with Chandoo Mondeti set to return as the director. The film is expected to be released in 2024, but no official announcement has been made yet.

Notes
------

* Karthikeya 2 is the first Telugu film to be released in IMAX format.
* The film's cinematography was handled by Karthik Ghattamaneni, who previously worked on the first installment of the Karthikeya series.
* Anupama Parameswaran played the role of Mugdha, a historian, in the film.

article:
2022 NFL Draft

The 2022 NFL Draft was the 87th annual meeting of National Football League (NFL) franchises to select newly eligible players for the upcoming 2022 season. The draft took place from April 28 to 30, 2022, in Las Vegas, Nevada. A total of 262 players were selected over the course of the three-day event.

# Host city

The 2022 NFL Draft was held in Las Vegas, Nevada, marking the first time the city has hosted the event. The draft was originally scheduled to take place in Las Vegas in 2020, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it was instead held virtually. The 2022 draft was held in a unique outdoor setting, with a stage located on the Las Vegas Strip, in front of the Caesars Forum.

# Player selections

The 2022 NFL Draft consisted of seven rounds, with each of the 32 NFL teams having one selection in each round. The order of the first round was determined by the previous season's standings, with the worst team picking first and the Super Bowl winner picking last. The remaining rounds were also determined by the previous season's standings, but with teams that made the playoffs picking after non-playoff teams.

The first overall selection was Travon Walker, a defensive end from the University of Georgia, who was selected by the Jacksonville Jaguars. The top five selections were rounded out by Aidan Hutchinson, a defensive end from the University of Michigan, selected by the Detroit Lions; Derek Stingley Jr., a cornerback from Louisiana State University, selected by the Houston Texans; Sauce Gardner, a cornerback from the University of Cincinnati, selected by the New York Jets; and Ikem Ekwonu, an offensive tackle from North Carolina State University, selected by the Carolina Panthers.

# Notable undrafted players

A number of notable players went undrafted in the 2022 NFL Draft, including running back Isaih Pacheco from Rutgers University, who signed with the Kansas City Chiefs, and wide receiver Bailey Zappe from Western Kentucky University, who signed with the New England Patriots. Other notable undrafted players include tight end Grant Calcaterra from Southern Methodist University, who signed with the Philadelphia Eagles, and defensive end Scott Patchan from Colorado State University, who signed with the Los Angeles Chargers.

# Trades

A number of trades took place during the 2022 NFL Draft, with teams moving up or down in the draft order to select specific players. One notable trade saw the New Orleans Saints trade up to the 11th overall selection, where they selected wide receiver Chris Olave from Ohio State University. The Saints traded their first and third-round selections, as well as a 2023 first-round selection, to the Washington Commanders to move up.

Another notable trade saw the Baltimore Ravens trade their first and fourth-round selections to the Arizona Cardinals to move up to the 14th overall selection, where they selected safety Kyle Hamilton from Notre Dame University.

# 2020 Resolution JC-2A selections

The 2020 Resolution JC-2A is a rule that allows teams to select players who were granted special eligibility for the 2022 NFL Draft. These players are typically players who were not eligible for the draft in previous years due to injury or other circumstances.

A total of six players were selected under the 2020 Resolution JC-2A in the 2022 NFL Draft, including wide receiver Wan'Dale Robinson from the University of Kentucky, who was selected by the New York Giants in the second round.

The 2023 Martyr's Memorial A-Division League was the 43rd season of the Martyr's Memorial A-Division League, the top division of Nepalese football. The season began on 4 February 2023 and concluded on 24 April 2023.

article:
2022 Singapore Open (badminton)

The 2022 Singapore Open was a badminton tournament that took place at the Singapore Indoor Stadium in Singapore from July 12 to July 17, 2022. The tournament was part of the 2022 BWF World Tour and was the 18th Super 500 event of the 2022 World Tour.

# Tournament

## Venue

The tournament was held at the Singapore Indoor Stadium, a multi-purpose indoor arena located in Kallang, Singapore. The stadium has a seating capacity of 12,000 and has hosted numerous international badminton tournaments, including the Singapore Open.

## Point distribution

The tournament followed the standard BWF point distribution system, with the winner of each event receiving 9,200 points, the runner-up receiving 7,800 points, and the semifinalists receiving 6,420 points.

## Prize pool

The total prize pool for the tournament was $370,000, with the winner of each event receiving a significant share of the prize money.

# Men's singles

## Seeds

The top seeds in the men's singles event were:

1. Kento Momota (Japan)
2. Viktor Axelsen (Denmark)
3. Anders Antonsen (Denmark)
4. Anthony Sinisuka Ginting (Indonesia)
5. Jonatan Christie (Indonesia)
6. Lee Zii Jia (Malaysia)
7. Ng Ka Long (Hong Kong)
8. Wang Tzu-wei (Taiwan)

## Finals

The final of the men's singles event was contested between Kento Momota and Viktor Axelsen. Momota won the match in three games, 21-14, 21-19, 21-18.

article:
Hurricane Fiona was a powerful and destructive tropical cyclone that caused catastrophic damage and loss of life in several Caribbean islands and eastern Canada in September 2022. The sixth named storm and fourth hurricane of the 2022 Atlantic hurricane season, Fiona formed from a tropical wave that emerged from the west coast of Africa on September 1.

# Meteorological history

Fiona originated from a tropical wave that emerged from the west coast of Africa on September 1. The wave moved westward across the tropical Atlantic, showing signs of organization and development. On September 12, a low-pressure system formed within the wave, and by September 13, the system had developed a closed circulation and was designated as Tropical Depression Seven. The depression strengthened into Tropical Storm Fiona on September 14, while located about 600 miles (965 km) east of the Lesser Antilles.

Fiona continued to intensify as it moved westward, becoming a hurricane on September 16. The storm's intensity fluctuated over the next few days due to internal dynamics and wind shear. However, on September 18, Fiona underwent rapid intensification, becoming a Category 4 hurricane with winds of 140 mph (225 km/h). The storm's peak intensity was reached on September 20, with maximum sustained winds of 150 mph (240 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 926 mbar (27.34 inHg).

# Preparations

As Fiona approached the Caribbean, several islands issued tropical cyclone warnings and watches. In Guadeloupe, a hurricane warning was issued on September 15, and residents were advised to stock up on food and water. In Puerto Rico, a hurricane watch was issued on September 16, and the government activated its emergency response plan. The Dominican Republic also issued a hurricane warning on September 17, and the government declared a state of emergency.

In the Turks and Caicos Islands, a hurricane warning was issued on September 18, and residents were advised to evacuate to higher ground. In Antigua, a hurricane watch was issued on September 19, and the government advised residents to prepare for the storm. In Bermuda, a tropical storm watch was issued on September 20, and residents were advised to prepare for strong winds and heavy rain.

# Impact

Fiona caused catastrophic damage and loss of life in several Caribbean islands and eastern Canada.

## Guadeloupe

Fiona made landfall in Guadeloupe on September 17, bringing strong winds and heavy rain. The storm caused widespread power outages, with over 80% of the island's residents left without electricity. Several homes were destroyed, and many roads were blocked by fallen trees and debris.

## Puerto Rico

Fiona made landfall in Puerto Rico on September 18, causing widespread damage and flooding. The storm's strong winds knocked out power to over 80% of the island's residents, and several homes were destroyed. The storm's heavy rain caused widespread flooding, with several rivers overflowing their banks.

## Dominican Republic

Fiona made landfall in the Dominican Republic on September 19, causing widespread damage and flooding. The storm's strong winds knocked out power to over 70% of the country's residents, and several homes were destroyed. The storm's heavy rain caused widespread flooding, with several rivers overflowing their banks.

## Turks and Caicos

Fiona made landfall in the Turks and Caicos Islands on September 20, causing widespread damage and flooding. The storm's strong winds knocked out power to over 90% of the islands' residents, and several homes were destroyed. The storm's heavy rain caused widespread flooding, with several roads and buildings damaged.

## Antigua

Fiona passed close to Antigua on September 20, causing strong winds and heavy rain. The storm's strong winds knocked out power to over 50% of the island's residents, and several homes were damaged. The storm's heavy rain caused widespread flooding, with several roads and buildings damaged.

## Bermuda

Fiona passed close to Bermuda on September 24, causing strong winds and heavy rain. The storm's strong winds knocked out power to over 30% of the island's residents, and several homes were damaged. The storm's heavy rain caused widespread flooding, with several roads and buildings damaged.

## Eastern Canada

Fiona made landfall in eastern Canada on September 24, causing widespread damage and flooding. The storm's strong winds knocked out power to over 500,000 residents, and several homes were destroyed. The storm's heavy rain caused widespread flooding, with several rivers overflowing their banks.

# Aftermath

The aftermath of Fiona was marked by widespread destruction and loss of life.

## Puerto Rico

In Puerto Rico, the storm's aftermath was marked by widespread power outages and flooding. The government activated its emergency response plan, and several relief centers were established. The storm's damage was estimated at over $3 billion, and several homes were destroyed.

## Dominican Republic

In the Dominican Republic, the storm's aftermath was marked by widespread power outages and flooding. The government declared a state of emergency, and several relief centers were established. The storm's damage was estimated at over $2 billion, and several homes were destroyed.

# Retirement

Due to the catastrophic damage and loss of life caused by Fiona, the name was retired from the list of Atlantic hurricane names in 2023.

article:
Midnights
================

Midnights is the tenth studio album by American singer-songwriter Taylor Swift, released on October 21, 2022, through Republic Records. The album marks a return to Swift's pop roots, exploring themes of introspection, self-discovery, and personal growth. Midnights received widespread critical acclaim and commercial success, breaking multiple records and solidifying Swift's position as a leading figure in contemporary music.

Background
----------

Midnights was first announced by Swift on August 28, 2022, during the MTV Video Music Awards. The album's title, tracklist, and release date were revealed on Swift's social media accounts, generating significant buzz among fans and media outlets. Swift had been relatively quiet in the years leading up to Midnights, having released her eighth and ninth studio albums, Folklore and Evermore, in 2020. The surprise announcement sparked speculation about the album's themes, sound, and production.

Concept and writing
-------------------

Midnights is an introspective album that explores Swift's personal experiences, emotions, and thoughts. The album's concept is centered around the idea of Swift's "midnights," a metaphor for the moments of clarity and introspection that occur during the quiet hours of the night.

### Themes

The album's themes are diverse and complex, ranging from love and relationships to self-discovery, anxiety, and personal growth. Swift tackles topics such as the pressures of fame, the fragility of relationships, and the importance of self-care. The album also touches on themes of nostalgia, memory, and the passage of time.

Production and music
---------------------

Midnights was produced by Swift, Jack Antonoff, and Aaron Dessner, among others. The album's sound is characterized by a blend of pop, electronic, and indie rock elements, with a focus on atmospheric production and introspective lyrics. The album features a range of instrumentation, including synthesizers, guitars, and orchestral arrangements.

Artwork and aesthetics
----------------------

The album's artwork features a photograph of Swift taken by Beth Garrabrant, with a minimalist design and typography. The album's aesthetic is characterized by a muted color palette, with a focus on blues, purples, and blacks. The artwork has been praised for its simplicity and elegance.

Release and promotion
---------------------

Midnights was released on October 21, 2022, through Republic Records. The album was available on all major streaming platforms, as well as on CD and vinyl. Swift promoted the album through a series of social media posts, interviews, and performances, including a live performance on Saturday Night Live.

Commercial performance
---------------------

Midnights was a commercial success, debuting at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart and selling over 1 million copies in its first week. The album broke multiple records, including the largest sales week of 2022 and the biggest streaming debut of all time. The album also reached number one in multiple countries, including the UK, Australia, and Canada.

Critical reception
-----------------

Midnights received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising Swift's songwriting, production, and vocals. The album has been praised for its introspective lyrics, atmospheric soundscapes, and cohesive theme.

### Rankings

Midnights has been ranked on several year-end lists, including Rolling Stone's 50 Best Albums of 2022 and Billboard's 50 Best Albums of 2022.

Awards
------

Midnights has been nominated for several awards, including the Grammy Award for Album of the Year and the American Music Award for Favorite Pop/Rock Album.

Impact
--------

Midnights has had a significant impact on popular culture, with many praising Swift's ability to create music that resonates with a wide audience. The album has also sparked conversations about mental health, self-care, and the importance of introspection.

2022 Caribbean Premier League

The 2022 Caribbean Premier League (CPL) was the tenth season of the Caribbean Premier League, the domestic T20 cricket league of the Caribbean. The tournament was played from August 31 to September 30, 2022. Six teams participated in the tournament, with the Jamaica Tallawahs winning their third title.

Squads

The following squads were announced for the 2022 Caribbean Premier League:

* Barbados Royals: Jason Holder (c), Obed McCoy, Kyle Mayers, Hayden Walsh, Oshane Thomas, Nyeem Young, Justin Greaves, Azam Khan, Rahkeem Cornwall, Harry Tector, Devon Thomas, Joshua Bishop, Corbin Bosch, Nyeem Young, Teddy Bishop

================

The cyclone caused widespread damage, flooding, and landslides, resulting in significant disruptions to daily life and the economy.

Meteorological History

Cyclone Gabrielle formed on February 5, 2023, as a tropical low-pressure system over the Coral Sea, northeast of Australia. The system gradually intensified as it moved southwest, becoming a tropical cyclone on February 7. Over the next few days, Gabrielle continued to strengthen, reaching category 3 status on the Australian cyclone intensity scale on February 10. The cyclone then began to move southeast, towards the eastern coast of New Zealand.

article:
The Federal Prosecution of Donald Trump (Election Obstruction Case) refers to the ongoing federal prosecution of Donald Trump, the 45th President of the United States, related to his alleged efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election. The case is being handled by the United States Department of Justice (DOJ) and is one of several investigations into Trump's actions following the 2020 election.

# Background

## Accusations of electoral fraud and attempts to overturn the election

Following the 2020 presidential election, Trump repeatedly made false claims of widespread electoral fraud and attempted to overturn the results of the election. He and his allies filed numerous lawsuits in several states, but most were dismissed due to lack of evidence. Trump also pressured state officials, including the Secretary of State of Georgia, to change the outcome of the election.

## January 6 Capitol attack and investigations

On January 6, 2021, a mob of Trump supporters stormed the United States Capitol, attempting to prevent the certification of President-elect Joe Biden's victory. The incident resulted in five deaths and numerous injuries. The DOJ launched an investigation into the attack, and several individuals have been charged with crimes related to the incident.

# Original indictment and arraignment

On June 8, 2023, a federal grand jury returned an indictment against Trump, charging him with four counts related to his efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election. The indictment alleged that Trump conspired to defraud the United States, obstruct an official proceeding, and deprive individuals of their rights under the Constitution and laws of the United States.

Trump was arraigned on June 13, 2023, and pleaded not guilty to all charges. The arraignment was held in the United States District Court for the District of Columbia, and Trump was released on his own recognizance.

# Superseding indictment and arraignment

On August 1, 2023, a superseding indictment was returned against Trump, adding additional allegations and charges. The superseding indictment included new charges related to Trump's alleged conspiracy to obstruct an official proceeding and his efforts to pressure state officials to change the outcome of the election.

Trump was arraigned on the superseding indictment on August 8, 2023, and again pleaded not guilty to all charges.

# Statements in the indictment

## Allegations and statements

The indictment alleged that Trump and his co-conspirators engaged in a multi-faceted effort to overturn the 2020 presidential election, including:

* Making false claims of widespread electoral fraud
* Pressuring state officials to change the outcome of the election
* Filing lawsuits to challenge the election results
* Inciting violence and intimidation against individuals involved in the election process

## Count One: Conspiracy to defraud the United States

The indictment alleged that Trump and his co-conspirators conspired to defraud the United States by attempting to overturn the 2020 presidential election. The conspiracy allegedly involved making false claims of widespread electoral fraud and pressuring state officials to change the outcome of the election.

## Further allegations and statements

The indictment further alleged that Trump and his co-conspirators:

* Knew that their claims of widespread electoral fraud were false
* Made repeated attempts to pressure state officials to change the outcome of the election
* Incited violence and intimidation against individuals involved in the election process

## Count Two: Conspiracy to obstruct an official proceeding

The indictment alleged that Trump and his co-conspirators conspired to obstruct an official proceeding by attempting to prevent the certification of President-elect Joe Biden's victory. The conspiracy allegedly involved making false claims of widespread electoral fraud and pressuring state officials to change the outcome of the election.

## Count Three: Obstruction of an official proceeding

The indictment alleged that Trump and his co-conspirators obstructed an official proceeding by attempting to prevent the certification of President-elect Joe Biden's victory. The obstruction allegedly involved making false claims of widespread electoral fraud and pressuring state officials to change the outcome of the election.

## Count Four: Conspiracy against rights

The indictment alleged that Trump and his co-conspirators conspired to deprive individuals of their rights under the Constitution and laws of the United States. The conspiracy allegedly involved making false claims of widespread electoral fraud and pressuring state officials to change the outcome of the election.

# Co-conspirators

The indictment named several individuals as co-conspirators, including:

* Rudy Giuliani, Trump's personal attorney
* John Eastman, a former Trump advisor
* Jeffrey Clark, a former Justice Department official

# Pretrial proceedings

## Initial timetable

The court established an initial timetable for the pretrial proceedings, including:

* June 15, 2023: Deadline for Trump to file pretrial motions
* July 1, 2023: Deadline for the government to respond to Trump's pretrial motions
* August 1, 2023: Deadline for Trump to file a response to the government's motions

## Protective orders and security measures

The court issued protective orders and security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure the safety of individuals involved in the case.

## Other pre-trial motions

The parties filed several other pretrial motions, including:

* Motions to compel discovery
* Motions to suppress evidence
* Motions to dismiss certain charges

## Immunity dispute

The parties engaged in a dispute over the issue of immunity for certain witnesses. The government argued that the witnesses were entitled to immunity, while Trump's defense team argued that the witnesses were not entitled to immunity.

### Appeals

The immunity dispute was appealed to the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit.

### Proceedings resulting from the immunity decision

The appeals court ruled in favor of the government, holding that the witnesses were entitled to immunity. The decision was appealed to the United States Supreme Court.

## Post-immunity timetable

Following the immunity decision, the court established a new timetable for the pretrial proceedings, including:

* September 1, 2023: Deadline for Trump to file additional pretrial motions
* October 1, 2023: Deadline for the government to respond to Trump's additional pretrial motions
* November 1, 2023: Deadline for Trump to file a response to the government's additional motions

# Potential witnesses and evidence

## Prosecution

The prosecution has identified several potential witnesses and evidence, including:

* Former Trump officials and advisors
* State officials who were pressured by Trump to change the outcome of the election
* Documents and records related to Trump's efforts to overturn the election

## Defense

The defense has identified several potential witnesses and evidence, including:

* Trump's personal attorney, Rudy Giuliani
* Trump's former advisor, John Eastman
* Documents and records related to the election and Trump's efforts to challenge the results

# Reactions

## Defendant

Trump has denied any wrongdoing and has characterized the indictment as a "witch hunt."

## Republicans in support of the indictment

Several Republicans have expressed support for the indictment, including:

* Senator Mitt Romney
* Representative Liz Cheney

## Republicans opposed to the indictment

Several Republicans have expressed opposition to the indictment, including:

* Senator Ted Cruz
* Representative Jim Jordan

## Democrats in support of the indictment

Several Democrats have expressed support for the indictment, including:

* President Joe Biden
* Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi

The 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup qualification was the qualification process for the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup, which will be the 41st edition of the AFC U-20 Asian Cup. A total of 44 teams from the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) entered the competition, competing for 16 spots in the final tournament.

# Format changes
The AFC U-20 Asian Cup qualification format was changed from the previous edition. The qualification process was expanded to include more teams, with 44 teams participating in the competition, an increase from the 40 teams that participated in the 2018 edition. The qualification process was also moved to a single-venue format, where all matches in each group were played in a single venue.

# Draw
The draw for the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup qualification was held on 24 June 2022 in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The 44 teams were divided into 11 groups of four teams each. The teams were seeded based on their performance in the 2018 AFC U-19 Championship and the 2020 AFC U-19 Championship qualifying competition.

# Player eligibility
Players born on or after 1 January 2003 were eligible to compete in the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup qualification. Each team was allowed to register a maximum of 23 players for the competition.

# Format
The 44 teams were divided into 11 groups of four teams each. Each team played the other teams in their group once, with the top team in each group qualifying for the final tournament. The 11 group winners qualified directly for the final tournament, while the five best runners-up also qualified.

## Tiebreakers
In the event that two or more teams were tied on points at the end of the group stage, the tiebreakers were applied in the following order:

1. Goal difference
2. Number of goals scored
3. Head-to-head matches between the tied teams
4. Disciplinary points (yellow and red cards)

article:
2022 Malaysia Open (badminton)

The 2022 Malaysia Open was a badminton tournament that took place at the Axiata Arena in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, from June 28 to July 3, 2022. It was the 12th tournament of the 2022 BWF World Tour and was part of the Malaysia Open, which had been held annually since 1937.

Tournament

### Venue

The tournament was held at the Axiata Arena in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The arena has a seating capacity of 10,000 spectators and features a retractable roof. It has hosted numerous international badminton tournaments, including the Malaysia Open, the BWF World Championships, and the Sudirman Cup.

### Point distribution

The 2022 Malaysia Open was a Super 750 tournament on the BWF World Tour, meaning that it offered a higher number of ranking points than Super 500 and Super 300 tournaments but fewer points than Super 1000 tournaments. The point distribution was as follows:

* Winner: 11,000 points
* Runner-up: 9,350 points
* Semi-finalists: 7,700 points
* Quarter-finalists: 6,050 points
* Round of 16: 4,320 points
* Round of 32: 2,660 points
* Round of 64: 1,670 points

### Prize pool

The total prize pool for the 2022 Malaysia Open was $675,000, with the winners of each discipline receiving $47,250.

Men's singles

### Seeds

The following players were seeded in the men's singles discipline:

1.  Viktor Axelsen (Denmark)
2.  Kento Momota (Japan)
3.  Anders Antonsen (Denmark)
4.  Chou Tien-chen (Taiwan)
5.  Anthony Sinisuka Ginting (Indonesia)
6.  Lee Zii Jia (Malaysia)
7.  Jonatan Christie (Indonesia)
8.  Ng Ka Long (Hong Kong)

### Finals

Viktor Axelsen won the men's singles title, defeating Kento Momota 21-4, 21-7 in the final.

### Top half

#### Section 1

Viktor Axelsen defeated Liew Daren 21-13, 21-10 in the first round, while Kanta Tsuneyama defeated Cheam June Wei 21-19, 21-14. Axelsen then defeated Tsuneyama 21-14, 21-16 in the second round.

#### Section 2

Kento Momota defeated Leong Jun Hao 21-15, 21-10 in the first round, while Ng Tze Yong defeated Tanongsak Saensomboonsuk 21-19, 21-14. Momota then defeated Ng 21-12, 21-15 in the second round.

### Bottom half

#### Section 3

Anders Antonsen defeated Soong Joo Ven 21-16, 21-14 in the first round, while Chou Tien-chen defeated Lee Chia-hao 21-19, 21-17. Antonsen then defeated Chou 21-18, 13-21, 21-19 in the second round.

#### Section 4

Lee Zii Jia defeated Wong Wing Ki 21-15, 21-15 in the first round, while Anthony Sinisuka Ginting defeated Lu Guangzu 21-16, 21-17. Lee then defeated Ginting 21-18, 19-21, 21-18 in the second round.

Women's singles

### Seeds

The following players were seeded in the women's singles discipline:

1.  Akane Yamaguchi (Japan)
2.  Chen Yufei (China)
3.  An Se-young (South Korea)

8.  He Bingjiao (China)

### Finals

Ratchanok Intanon won the women's singles title, defeating Chen Yufei 21-15, 21-15 in the final.

### Top half

#### Section 2

Chen Yufei defeated Pornpawee Chochuwong 21-13, 21-15 in the first round, while Sayaka Takahashi defeated Mia Blichfeldt 21-18, 21-17. Chen then defeated Takahashi 21-11, 21-15 in the second round.

### Bottom half

#### Section 3

An Se-young defeated Yeo Jia Min 21-14, 21-18 in the first round, while Carolina Marín defeated Han Yue 21-19, 21-14. An then defeated Marín 21-18, 21-16 in the second round.

#### Section 4

Ratchanok Intanon defeated Aya Ohori 21-11, 21-13 in the first round, while Nozomi Okuhara defeated Gregoria Mariska Tunjung 21-19, 21-15. Intanon then defeated Okuhara 21-14, 21-18 in the second round.

Men's doubles

### Seeds

The following pairs were seeded in the men's doubles discipline:

1.  Kevin Sanjaya Sukamuljo / Marcus Fernaldi Gideon (Indonesia)

### Top half

Chen Qingchen and Jia Yifan defeated Siti Fadia Silva Ramadhanti and Ribka Sugiarto 21-14, 21-17 in the first round, while Vivian Hoo and Lim Chiew Sien defeated Ashwini Bhat / Shikha Gautam 21-13, 21-12. Chen and Jia then defeated Hoo and Lim 21-14, 21-19 in the second round.

#### Section 2

Lee So-hee and Shin Seung-chan defeated Benyapa Aimsaard and Nuntakarn Aimsaard 21-14, 21-16 in the first round, while Pearly Tan and Thinaah Muralitharan defeated Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand 21-13, 21-16. Lee and Shin then defeated Tan and Muralitharan 21-15, 21-18 in the second round.

### Bottom half

#### Section 3

Yuki Fukushima and Sayaka Hirota defeated Fie Olesen and Lena Grebak 21-13, 21-14 in the first round, while Liu Xuanxuan and Xia Yuting defeated Anastasiia Akchurina and Olga Morozova 21-18, 21-15. Fukushima and Hirota then defeated Liu and Xia 21-18, 21-12 in the second round.

#### Section 4

Greysia Polii and Apriyani Rahayu defeated Lanny Tria Mayasari and Jesita Putri Miantoro 21-10, 21-12 in the first round, while Zhang Shuxian and Zheng Yu defeated Rin Iwanaga and Kie Nakanishi 21-14, 21-19. Polii and Rahayu then defeated Zhang and Zheng 21-15, 21-16 in the second round.

Mixed doubles

### Seeds

### Finals

Zheng Siwei and Huang Yaqiong won the mixed doubles title, defeating Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Sapsiree Taerattanachai 21-13, 21-18 in the final.

### Top half

#### Section 1

Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Sapsiree Taerattanachai defeated Hoo Pang Ron and Cheah Yee See 21-14, 21-16 in the first round, while Chen Tang Jie and Toh Ee Wei defeated Lee Jhe-huei and Hsu Ya-ching 21-10, 21-15. Puavaranukroh and Taerattanachai then defeated Chen and Toh 21-17, 21-19 in the second round.

article:
Tennent H. Bagley

Tennent H. Bagley is a retired CIA officer and author, best known for his work in counterintelligence and his writings on the Cold War-era espionage activities of the Soviet Union's KGB. Bagley's career spanned over four decades, during which he played a significant role in several high-profile cases involving Soviet spies and defectors.

#Early life and education

Tennent H. Bagley was born on August 19, 1925, in Alameda, California. He grew up in a family of modest means and was the youngest of three children. Bagley's early life was marked by a strong interest in languages and international affairs, which would later serve him well in his career as a CIA officer. He attended the University of California, Berkeley, where he studied Russian and European history.

#Career

Bagley joined the CIA in 1952, shortly after graduating from college. He began his career as a junior officer in the agency's Soviet Division, where he worked on analyzing Soviet military capabilities and identifying potential security threats. Over the years, Bagley rose through the ranks, becoming a specialist in counterintelligence and eventually serving as the chief of the CIA's Soviet Bloc Division.

During his career, Bagley was involved in numerous high-profile cases involving Soviet spies and defectors. He worked closely with other intelligence agencies, including the FBI and British MI5, to identify and counter Soviet espionage activities. Bagley's expertise in counterintelligence and his knowledge of Soviet operations made him a valuable asset to the CIA.

##Bagley's Analysis of the KGB-CIA War

In his book "Spy Wars," Bagley provides a detailed analysis of the KGB-CIA war, which he describes as a "war of wits" between the two intelligence agencies. According to Bagley, the KGB-CIA war was characterized by a series of espionage operations, double agents, and counterintelligence measures that played out over several decades.

Bagley argues that the KGB-CIA war was a critical aspect of the Cold War, as it involved the use of espionage and other clandestine activities to gather intelligence and influence policy. He notes that the KGB was highly effective in using its agents to penetrate the CIA and other Western intelligence agencies, while the CIA struggled to counter these efforts.

##The Popov Case

One of the most significant cases Bagley worked on was the Pyotr Popov case. Popov was a Soviet military officer who defected to the CIA in 1952. He provided the agency with valuable information about Soviet military capabilities and operations, including details about the Soviet Union's nuclear program.

Bagley was involved in the debriefing of Popov and played a key role in assessing the credibility of the information he provided. He notes that Popov's defection was a major coup for the CIA, as it provided the agency with unprecedented insight into Soviet military operations.

##The Golienewski Case

Another significant case Bagley worked on was the Michal Goleniewski case. Goleniewski was a Polish intelligence officer who defected to the CIA in 1960. He provided the agency with information about Polish intelligence operations and identified several Soviet spies who were operating in the West.

Bagley was involved in the debriefing of Goleniewski and helped to assess the credibility of the information he provided. He notes that Goleniewski's defection was significant, as it provided the CIA with valuable insight into Soviet intelligence operations in Eastern Europe.

##The Nosenko Case

One of the most infamous cases Bagley worked on was the Yuri Nosenko case. Nosenko was a KGB officer who defected to the CIA in 1962. He provided the agency with information about KGB operations and identified several Soviet spies who were operating in the West.

Bagley was involved in the debriefing of Nosenko and played a key role in assessing the credibility of the information he provided. However, Nosenko's defection was also marked by controversy, as some CIA officers questioned his credibility and motives.

##Nosenko and the "Zepp" Incident

One of the most significant incidents involving Nosenko was the "Zepp" case. In 1962, Nosenko provided the CIA with information about a KGB operation codenamed "Zepp," which involved the use of a double agent to penetrate the CIA.

Bagley was involved in the investigation of the Zepp case and helped to identify the double agent, who was later revealed to be a CIA officer named Lee Harvey Oswald. The Zepp case was significant, as it highlighted the KGB's ability to use double agents to penetrate the CIA.

##More Nosenko

Despite the controversy surrounding Nosenko's defection, Bagley remained convinced that he was a genuine defector who provided valuable information to the CIA. He notes that Nosenko's information helped the agency to identify several Soviet spies who were operating in the West and to disrupt KGB operations.

##The KITTY HAWK / Shadrin Case

Another significant case Bagley worked on was the Nicholas Shadrin case. Shadrin was a Soviet naval officer who defected to the CIA in 1959. He provided the agency with information about Soviet naval operations and identified several Soviet spies who were operating in the West.

Bagley was involved in the debriefing of Shadrin and helped to assess the credibility of the information he provided. He notes that Shadrin's defection was significant, as it provided the CIA with valuable insight into Soviet naval operations.

##Rebuttal to John L. Hart's HSCA testimony

In 1978, John L. Hart, a former CIA officer, testified before the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) and accused Bagley of being involved in a CIA plot to assassinate Lee Harvey Oswald. Bagley strongly denied these allegations and provided evidence to rebut Hart's claims.

##Reactions to his Spy Wars book

Bagley's book "Spy Wars" was widely praised by reviewers for its detailed analysis of the KGB-CIA war. However, some reviewers criticized Bagley for his handling of certain cases, including the Nosenko case.

##In popular culture

Bagley's career and writings have been the subject of several books, films, and television shows. He was portrayed by actor Brian Cox in the 2007 film "The Bourne Ultimatum."

article:
Rorschach (film)
================

Rorschach is a 2022 Indian Malayalam-language thriller film written and directed by Nisam Basheer. The film stars Mammootty in the lead role, and it marks his second collaboration with the director after the 2019 film Unda. Rorschach is a complex and layered thriller that explores the themes of trauma, revenge, and redemption.

Plot
-----

The film tells the story of Luke Anthony, a former cop who is haunted by a traumatic event from his past. Luke is a loner who lives in a remote area, and his life is marked by a sense of isolation and disconnection. However, when a series of mysterious events starts to unfold, Luke is drawn into a complex web of intrigue and deception. As he delves deeper into the mystery, Luke's past and present begin to collide, and he is forced to confront the demons that have haunted him for years.

Cast
-----

* Mammootty as Luke Anthony
* Bindu Panicker as Lucy
* Kottayam Nazeer as CI Mathew
* Sanju Sivram as Ravi
* Grace Antony as Fathima
* Jagadish as Suresh
* Nisam Basheer as Shibu

Production
------------

### Development

The idea for Rorschach was born out of a conversation between Nisam Basheer and Mammootty. The director had been toying with the idea of a thriller that explores the themes of trauma and redemption, and he saw Mammootty as the perfect fit for the lead role. The script was developed over several months, with Basheer working closely with Mammootty to flesh out the character of Luke Anthony.

### Filming

Principal photography for Rorschach began in March 2022 and lasted for approximately 40 days. The film was shot on location in Kerala, with the crew using a combination of real and constructed sets to create the desired atmosphere. The film's cinematographer, Nimish Ravi, used a mix of digital and film cameras to capture the desired aesthetic.

Music
------

The score for Rorschach was composed by Midhun Mukundan, who had previously worked with Basheer on Unda. The soundtrack features a mix of electronic and orchestral elements, with a focus on creating a sense of tension and unease. The film's sound design was handled by Sreejesh Nair, who used a combination of diegetic and non-diegetic sound effects to create a sense of immersion.

Marketing
----------

The marketing campaign for Rorschach was launched in July 2022, with the release of a series of teasers and trailers. The film's poster, which features Mammootty in a contemplative pose, was widely shared on social media, generating a lot of buzz among fans. The film's trailer, which was released in August, gave a glimpse into the film's complex plot and atmospheric score.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

Rorschach was released in theaters on October 7, 2022, in Kerala and other parts of India. The film received a wide release, with over 150 screens in Kerala alone. The film's opening day collections were strong, with many shows reporting houseful boards.

### Home media

Rorschach was released on Amazon Prime Video on November 11, 2022, after a successful theatrical run. The film's streaming release was widely anticipated, with many fans waiting to catch the film on the platform.

Reception
----------

### Box office

Rorschach was a commercial success, grossing over ₹20 crore at the box office. The film's collections were strong in Kerala, where it ran for over 50 days in many theaters. The film's success can be attributed to its strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews from critics.

### Critical response

Rorschach received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's complex plot, atmospheric score, and Mammootty's performance. The film's direction, cinematography, and sound design were also widely praised. The film holds a rating of 4.5/5 on IMDB, based on over 10,000 user reviews.

References
----------

External links
---------------

article:
Twitter
================

Twitter is a social networking and microblogging service that allows users to send and read short messages, called "tweets." Founded in 2006, Twitter has become one of the most popular social media platforms in the world, with over 440 million monthly active users.

History
--------

### 2006–2007: Creation and initial reaction

Twitter was created in March 2006 by Jack Dorsey, Evan Williams, Biz Stone, and Noah Glass. The idea for the service was born out of a failed podcasting company called Odeo. The first tweet was sent on March 21, 2006, by Jack Dorsey, and read "just setting up my twttr." Initially, the service was intended for use by individuals, but it quickly gained popularity among businesses and organizations.

In 2007, Twitter gained widespread attention at the South by Southwest (SXSW) festival, where it was used to share updates and information about the event. This exposure helped to increase Twitter's user base and established it as a major player in the social media landscape.

### 2007–2010

Between 2007 and 2010, Twitter experienced rapid growth, with the number of users increasing from 1 million to 18 million. During this period, the company introduced several new features, including the ability to reply to tweets and the use of hashtags to categorize tweets.

In 2008, Twitter introduced the @mention system, which allowed users to mention other users in their tweets. This feature helped to increase engagement on the platform and made it easier for users to connect with each other.

### 2010–2014

In 2010, Twitter introduced the "New Twitter" interface, which featured a more streamlined design and improved functionality. This update helped to increase user engagement and made it easier for new users to join the platform.

In 2011, Twitter acquired the social media monitoring company, Dasient. This acquisition helped to improve Twitter's ability to detect and prevent spam on the platform.

### 2014–2020

In 2014, Twitter acquired the video-sharing app, Vine. This acquisition helped to expand Twitter's offerings and provided users with a new way to share content.

In 2015, Twitter introduced the " Moments" feature, which allowed users to curate tweets around a particular topic or event. This feature helped to increase user engagement and made it easier for users to discover new content.

### 2020–2022

In 2020, Twitter introduced the " Fleets" feature, which allowed users to post ephemeral content that disappeared after 24 hours. This feature was designed to compete with Instagram's "Stories" feature.

In 2021, Twitter acquired the newsletter company, Revue. This acquisition helped to expand Twitter's offerings and provided users with a new way to share content.

### 2022–present: Transition to X

In 2022, Twitter was acquired by Elon Musk, who announced plans to rebrand the platform as "X". This rebranding effort is ongoing, and it is unclear what changes will be made to the platform.

Appearance and features
----------------------

### Tweets

Tweets are the core feature of Twitter. They are short messages that can be up to 280 characters in length. Users can post tweets using the Twitter website or mobile app.

### Multimedia content

Twitter allows users to post multimedia content, including images, videos, and live streams. This content can be shared using the Twitter website or mobile app.

### Curation

Twitter provides several features that allow users to curate content, including:

#### Trending topics

Trending topics are topics that are currently popular on Twitter. They are displayed on the Twitter homepage and can be accessed using the Twitter mobile app.

#### Lists

Lists are a way for users to curate tweets around a particular topic or theme. Users can create lists and add tweets to them using the Twitter website or mobile app.

#### Moments

Moments are a way for users to curate tweets around a particular topic or event. They are displayed on the Twitter homepage and can be accessed using the Twitter mobile app.

### Algorithm

Twitter uses an algorithm to determine the order in which tweets are displayed on the platform. This algorithm takes into account a variety of factors, including the user's engagement history and the relevance of the tweet to the user.

### Mobile

Twitter has a mobile app that allows users to access the platform on-the-go. The app provides many of the same features as the Twitter website, including the ability to post tweets and engage with other users.

### X Premium

X Premium is a paid subscription service that provides users with additional features and perks. These features include the ability to post longer tweets and access to exclusive content.

#### Verification of paid accounts

Verified accounts are accounts that have been verified by Twitter as belonging to a real person or organization. Verified accounts are denoted by a blue checkmark next to the user's name. Paid accounts are also eligible for verification.

### User monetization

Twitter provides several ways for users to monetize their content, including:

#### E-commerce

Twitter allows users to purchase products directly from the platform. This feature is available using the Twitter mobile app.

Usage
-----

### Demographics

Twitter's user base is diverse and global. According to a 2020 survey, the majority of Twitter users are between the ages of 18 and 29.

### Content

Twitter is used for a wide variety of purposes, including news, entertainment, and socializing.

### Levels of use

Twitter users can be categorized into several levels of use, including:

#### Casual users

Casual users are users who use Twitter occasionally, but do not engage with the platform regularly.

#### Power users

Power users are users who use Twitter frequently and engage with the platform regularly.

#### Influencers

Influencers are users who have a large following on Twitter and use the platform to promote products or services.

### User engagement

Twitter provides several features that allow users to engage with each other, including:

#### Replies

Replies are a way for users to respond to tweets. They can be posted using the Twitter website or mobile app.

#### Mentions

Mentions are a way for users to mention other users in their tweets. They can be posted using the Twitter website or mobile app.

#### Hashtags

Hashtags are a way for users to categorize tweets. They can be posted using the Twitter website or mobile app.

Branding
--------

### Logo evolution

Twitter's logo has undergone several changes since the platform's inception. The current logo features a stylized bird.

Finances
--------

### Revenue sources

Twitter generates revenue through several sources, including:

#### Advertising

Advertising is Twitter's primary source of revenue. The platform allows businesses to purchase ads that are displayed to users.

#### Data licensing

Data licensing is another source of revenue for Twitter. The platform licenses its data to third-party companies, which use it for a variety of purposes.

### Advertising bans

Twitter has banned several types of advertising on the platform, including:

#### Political advertising

Twitter banned political advertising on the platform in 2019.

#### Cryptocurrency advertising

Twitter banned cryptocurrency advertising on the platform in 2018.

### Fines

Twitter has been fined several times for violating regulations, including:

#### GDPR fine

Twitter was fined $547,000 in 2020 for violating the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

#### FTC fine

Twitter was fined $150 million in 2022 for violating the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) guidelines.

Technology
----------

### Implementation

Twitter is built using a variety of technologies, including:

#### Java

Java is the primary programming language used to build Twitter.

#### Scala

Scala is a programming language used to build some of Twitter's services.

#### Apache Kafka

Apache Kafka is a messaging system used by Twitter to handle high volumes of data.

### API and developer platform

Twitter provides an API and developer platform that allows developers to build applications on top of the platform.

### Innovators patent agreement

Twitter has an innovators patent agreement that allows developers to use its patents for free.

### Open source

Twitter has open-sourced several of its projects, including:

#### Apache Mesos

Apache Mesos is a cluster manager that is used by Twitter to manage its infrastructure.

#### Apache Aurora

Apache Aurora is a scheduler that is used by Twitter to manage its workflows.

### Interface

Twitter's interface is built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

### Security

Twitter takes several measures to ensure the security of its platform, including:

#### Encryption

Killing of Tyre Nichols

The killing of Tyre Nichols occurred on January 7, 2023, in Memphis, Tennessee, United States. Nichols, a 29-year-old African American man, was severely beaten by police officers during a traffic stop. The incident sparked widespread protests and calls for police reform.

People Involved

### Tyre Nichols

Tyre Nichols was a 29-year-old African American man who lived in Memphis, Tennessee. He was a skateboarder and worked at FedEx. Nichols had a four-year-old son and was known to his friends and family as a kind and gentle person.

### Police Officers

Several police officers were involved in the killing of Tyre Nichols. The officers were part of the Memphis Police Department's SCORPION Unit, which was established in 2021 to combat rising crime rates in the city.

### DeWayne Smith

DeWayne Smith is a Memphis police officer who was one of the first officers to respond to the scene of the traffic stop. Smith is a 25-year veteran of the police force and was previously honored as "Officer of the Year" in 2018.

SCORPION Unit

The SCORPION Unit is a specialized unit within the Memphis Police Department that was established in 2021. The unit was created to combat rising crime rates in the city and was composed of 40 officers who were tasked with patrolling high-crime areas. The unit was disbanded in January 2023, following the killing of Tyre Nichols.

Traffic Stop and Death

On January 7, 2023, Tyre Nichols was pulled over by police officers during a traffic stop. The officers were part of the SCORPION Unit and were in an unmarked car. Nichols was ordered to exit his vehicle and was then beaten by the officers. The beating was captured on video by a police body camera and showed Nichols being kicked, punched, and hit with a baton. The officers also used pepper spray on Nichols, who was heard crying out in pain.
